events.name: DataJam: O'Joy, Halogen and Open Data Projects
events.description:
DataJam: O'Joy, Halogen and Open Data Projects Following our latest Project Accelerator with O'Joy and Halogen, as well as the earlier Open Data event with OpenData ASEAN, we're holding a DataJam where volunteers can clean and do initial data analysis in one of the following teams: a) O’Joy  Established in 2004 by a group of social workers and professional counselors, O'Joy aims to enhance psycho-social well-being of the older persons, as well as their families. Data includes clinical assessment workflow, mental health and clinical measures related data. b) Halogen Halogen Foundation Singapore is dedicated to youth leadership and entrepreneurship development by building young leaders and entrepreneurs who will practically change the world in issues they believe in. Data includes survey results from programmes. c) Open Data Project: Anti-corruptionThis project aims to clean and perform exploratory analysis on relevant open data. d) Open Data Project: Healthcare ASEANThis project aims to clean and perform exploratory analysis on data related to the spread of malaria and dengue in the region. 


Special Notes • As this is a working session, we hope you understand our need to limit the attendance of this event. Priority will be given to those volunteers who have already engaged with the respective project teams.  • Please answer the RSVP questions at the end of your registration, so we can set up the project teams before the DataJam. If you don't reply, we might have to give your spot up to someone on the waiting list who has volunteered with us before. • Due to the sensitivity of some data, we will require you to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement before working on the data.   • Please bring your laptops and power, and be prepared to code! 


Agenda  9.30 am: Registration (please have your breakfast before turning up) 9.40 am: Introduction to Featured Organizations / Open Data Projects 10 am: Breakout to work in teams  1.30pm: Wrap-up and assign tasks for follow-up post-event Special thanks to Microsoft for being our venue sponsor! How it works • Each team of volunteers will be led by a Project Manager and Data Ambassador • There will be clean-up / preparation tasks for each team's datasets, which volunteers can pick to do • Team members will communicate on Trello (a simple task tracking tool) and Slack (a communication tool). Accounts for volunteers should be set up prior to the event. 

RSVP questions: When you RSVP, please let us know three things: 1)  Your full name (for registration purposes) 2)  Your email address (If you are confirmed going, we will add you to slack) 3)  Your preferred team - (a) O'Joy, (b) Halogen. (c) Anti-corruption, (d) Healthcare ASEAN We look forward to having you there!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: workshop 1 [Beginner]
events.description:
Hey everyone, we'll be having a 4 weeks workshop (every Saturday) on the basics of web programming that covers HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript. This programming workshop is meant for beginners who have zero experience and touch with any programming languages at all, and is interested to learn more about the web. Not only will you learn coding skills, you'll also learn essential programming concepts that will help build your core fundamentals and help you become a great programmer. Throughout the workshop lessons, you'll learn to build an eCommerce website and by the end of it, you'll have a fully fledged eCommerce site deployed on the web. All the workshops are free of charge (gratis). 



For the first lesson, we will be covering the basic and advanced HTML, and also basics of CSS. Light refreshments and snacks will be provided. 



Timing 11AM to 4PM Venue Ngee Ann Polytechnic, LT 73C. Things To Bring • Laptop • Github Account (github.com) • Cloud9 Account (c9.io) 



See you there! :)
events.location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489
